intermediate_stories.title: The School Garden
intermediate_stories.text: Mrs. Johnson's class decided to plant a garden at school. They planted tomatoes, carrots, and sunflowers. Every day, the students took turns watering the plants. After two months, the tomatoes turned red and the carrots grew big. The sunflowers became very tall, some reaching six feet high. The class was proud of their hard work and shared the vegetables with other classes.

intermediate_stories.title: The Lost Puppy
intermediate_stories.text: Sarah found a small puppy in her backyard. The puppy was brown and white with big, sad eyes. It had no collar and looked hungry. Sarah gave the puppy some water and a bowl of dog food. She put up posters around the neighborhood asking if anyone was missing a puppy. Three days later, a family called. They had been looking everywhere for their puppy named Buddy. Sarah was sad to see Buddy go, but happy that he was reunited with his family.

intermediate_stories.title: The Library Adventure
intermediate_stories.text: Maya loved to visit the library every Saturday. She would walk through the tall shelves filled with books about dinosaurs, space, and fairy tales. The librarian, Mrs. Chen, always helped Maya find new books to read. One day, Maya discovered a book about young inventors. She was so inspired that she decided to create her own invention. Maya spent weeks designing a special bookmark that would light up in the dark. She was proud of her creation and shared it with all her friends at school.

intermediate_stories.title: The Science Fair Project
intermediate_stories.text: Alex wanted to do something special for the science fair. He decided to study how plants grow with different types of music. Alex planted three bean seeds in separate pots. He played classical music to the first plant, rock music to the second, and no music to the third plant. After four weeks, he measured all three plants. The plant that listened to classical music grew the tallest, followed by the rock music plant. The plant with no music grew the least. Alex won second place at the science fair for his creative experiment.

questions.answer: how plants grow with different types of music

questions.answer: the one that listened to classical music

intermediate_stories.title: The Community Clean-Up
intermediate_stories.text: The students at Maple Elementary decided to help clean up their neighborhood park. They brought trash bags, gloves, and recycling bins. Emma's group collected cans and bottles for recycling. David's team picked up paper and plastic waste. Sofia's group planted new flowers near the playground. By the end of the day, they had filled twelve trash bags and planted twenty colorful flowers. The park looked beautiful again, and the community thanked the students for their hard work.

questions.answer: for their hard work cleaning the park

intermediate_stories.title: The Mysterious Footprints
intermediate_stories.text: After a snowstorm, Jenny noticed strange footprints in her backyard. The prints were small and round, leading from the fence to the bird feeder. Jenny was curious about what animal had visited during the night. She asked her grandfather, who was good at tracking animals. He examined the prints carefully and explained that they belonged to a raccoon. Raccoons are nocturnal, which means they are active at night. They often visit bird feeders looking for food. Jenny was excited to learn about her nighttime visitor.

intermediate_stories.title: The School Play
intermediate_stories.text: Mrs. Rodriguez's class was preparing for their end-of-year play about space exploration. Marcus played an astronaut, Lisa was the narrator, and Tommy was Mission Control. They practiced for three weeks, learning their lines and rehearsing their movements. Marcus had to remember the most lines because he was the main character. On the night of the performance, all the parents came to watch. The play was a huge success! The audience clapped loudly, and the principal said it was the best school play she had ever seen.

intermediate_stories.title: The Helpful Robot
intermediate_stories.text: In Mr. Kim's robotics class, students learned to build simple robots. Zoe and her partner Jake decided to create a robot that could help elderly people. Their robot had wheels to move around and a mechanical arm to pick up objects. It could also speak simple words like 'hello' and 'thank you.' The robot took them two months to build and program. When they demonstrated it at the school's invention showcase, many visitors were impressed. The local newspaper even wrote an article about their innovative creation.

intermediate_stories.title: The Weather Station
intermediate_stories.text: Carlos was fascinated by weather and decided to build a weather station for his backyard. With his father's help, he set up instruments to measure temperature, rainfall, and wind speed. Every morning before school, Carlos recorded the weather data in a special notebook. He noticed patterns: rainy days were usually cooler, and windy days often meant storms were coming. After six months of collecting data, Carlos created graphs to show the weather patterns. His teacher was so impressed that she invited him to present his findings to the whole school.
